item.title: Mike add a quote by Antony Beevor
Mike add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "Those who can make you believe absurdities, can make you commit atrocities." -- Voltaire

item.title: Mike add a quote by Jean Jacques Rousseau
item.description: "The truth brings no man a fortune." -- Jean Jacques Rousseau

item.title: Mike add a quote by Gordy Slack
item.description: "Popular disregard, even disdain, for demonstrable truth is the most dangerous thing that can happen to a democracy." -- Gordy Slack

item.title: Mike add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "There are means that cannot be excused. And I should like to be able to love my country and still love justice. I don't want just any greatness for it, particularly a greatness born of blood and falsehood. I want to keep it alive by keeping justice alive." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Mike add a quote by A.J.P. Taylor
item.description: "[Otto von Bismarck] only considered the interests of his own country - always the worst offense that a statesman can commit in the eyes of foreigners." -- A.J.P. Taylor

item.title: Mike add a quote by Otto von Bismarck
item.description: "Politics are not a science based on logic; they are the capacity of always choosing at each instant, in constantly changing situations, the least harmful, the most useful." -- Otto von Bismarck

item.title: Mike add a quote by Isaac Kramnick
item.description: "If you want to go public with your opinions, then someone is going to judge you a moron. And there is always a risk that you may be." -- Isaac Kramnick

item.title: Mike add a quote by Todd Gitlin
item.description: "[I]n politics, reputation is the prologue to fact..." -- Todd Gitlin

item.title: Mike add a quote by Fareed Zakaria
item.description: "...foreign policy is a matter of costs and benefits, not theology." -- Fareed Zakaria

item.title: Mike add a quote by Daniel Dennett
item.description: "There's nothing I like less than bad arguments for a view I hold dear." -- Daniel Dennett

item.title: Mike add a quote by Daniel C. Dennett
item.description: "Problems in science are sometimes made easier by adding complications." -- Daniel C. Dennett

item.title: Mike add a quote by James Madison
item.description: "Wherever the real power in a Government lies, there is the danger of oppression. In our Governments, the real power lies in the majority of the Community, and the invasion of private rights is chiefly to be apprehended, not from the acts of Government contrary to the sense of its constituents, but from acts in which the Government is the mere instrument of the major number of the constituents." -- James Madison
